1.question:
What is the capital of Ontario?
A. Ottawa
B. Toronto
C. Kingston
D. Waterloo
1.correct: Way to go. It is Toronto!
1.incorrect: Province & state capitals aren't always the biggest city, but in this case it is indeed Toronto.

2.question:
What is Canada's largest Metropolitan area?
A. Toronto
B. Calgary
C. Vancouver
D. Montreal
2.correct: You got it. Toronto is Canada's largest metropolitan with over 6 million people.
2.incorrect: Wrong answer. Toronto is Canada's largest metropolitan with over 6 million people.

3.question:
What rank is the Trans-Canada Highway amongst the longest highways in the world?
A. 1
B. 2
C. 3
D. 4
3.correct: That is correct. Trans-Canada Highway is fourth - Total length: 4,860 miles (7,821 km)
3.incorrect: Sorry, but Trans-Canada Highway is fourth - Total length: 4,860 miles (7,821 km)

4.question:
Which of the following bays in Canada have the highest tides in the world?
A. Hudson Bay
B. Baffin Bay
C. Bay of Fundy
D. James Bay
4.correct: Thats right - The highest tides in the world can be found in Canada at the Bay of Fundy.
4.incorrect: Not quite. The highest tides in the world can be found in Canada at the Bay of Fundy.

5.question:
How many NBA championships have the Toronto Raptors won?
A. 2
B. 3
C. 1
D. 0
5.incorrect: Nope. The correct answer is 1, in 2019.

6.question:
Which province is the largest producer of Maple Syrup in Canada?
A. Quebec
B. Ontario
C. New Brunswick
D. Nova Scotia
6.correct: Correct! Quebec produces 90% of Canada's maple syrup and nearly 72% of maple syrup production worldwide.
6.incorrect: Nope. The correct answer is Quebec produces 90% of Canada's maple syrup and nearly 72% of maple syrup production worldwide.

7.question:
Canada houses the biggest uranium mine. What province the biggest Uranium mine located in?
A. British Columbia
B. Winnipeg
C. Alberta
D. Saskatchewan
7.correct: Nice work! McArthur River mine located about 620km north of Saskatoon, Saskatchewan, Canada, is currently the world’s largest uranium producing mine.
7.incorrect: Not quite. McArthur River mine located about 620km north of Saskatoon, Saskatchewan, is currently the world’s largest uranium producing mine.

8.question:
What is the highest temperature ever recorded in Toronto?
A. 49°C / 120F
B. 40°C / 104F
C. 36°C / 97F
D. 29°C / 84F
8.correct: Yep, The highest temperature ever recorded in Toronto, Ontario was 40.6 °C / 104 F which occurred on July 10, 1936.
8.incorrect: Nope, The highest temperature ever recorded in Toronto, Ontario was 40.6 °C / 104 F which occurred on July 10, 1936.

9.question:
What year did The Great Fire of Toronto happened?
A. 1966
B. 1949
C. 1904
D. 1889
9.correct: Thats right, The Great Fire of Toronto in 1904 destroyed much of the city.
9.incorrect: Not quite. It was 1904 and destroyed much of the city.

10.question:
Toronto Zoo is the largest zoo in Canada and _________ biggest zoo in the world.
A. first
B. third
C. eight
D. sixth
10.correct: Correct! Toronto Zoo is 710 acres large. And also has 491 species and over 16,000 animals to enjoy.
10.incorrect: Its actually third biggest zoo in the world, 710 acres large. And also has 491 species and over 16,000 animals to enjoy.

11.question:
For how many years was CN Tower the tallest freestanding structure in the World?
A. 32
B. 10
C. 17
D. 27
11.incorrect: Nope. CN Tower was the freestanding structure in the world for 32 years (1975-2007).

12.question:
Where did National Geographic rank St Lawrence Market in Toronto on their list of top 10 markets in the world? 
A. 7
B. 4
C. 3
D. 1
12.correct: You got it! National Geographic ranked St Lawrence Market as the best market in the world! Saturday is the market day, with over 120 retailers
12.incorrect: Nope. National Geographic ranked St Lawrence Market as the best market in the world! Saturday is the market day, with over 120 retailers

13.question:
Where does Toronto rank on the list of largest cities in North America by Population?
A. 2nd
B. 4th
C. 7th
D. 12th
13.correct: Thats right, at 2.8 million, Toronto is just larger than Chicago.
13.incorrect: Its actually the 4th largest city in North America behind Mexico City, New York, and Los Angeles.

14.question:
What percent of the world's fresh water reserves are located in Canada?
A. 5%
B. 10%
C. 20%
D. 33%
14.correct: You go it! Thats a lot of water.
14.incorrect: Nope - its 20%, which is a lot of water.

15.question:
Ontario is the most populous provinces or territories in Canada, but which has the lowest population?
A. Prince Edward Island
B. Northwest Territory
C. Yukon 
D. Nunavut
15.correct: You got it. There are only ~37,000 people who live in Nunavut, which has means there are over 50 Sq.Km. per person.
15.incorrect: Not quite. Its Nunavut, which has only 37,000 residence.

16.question:
What is the official bird of Ontario?
A. Common Loon
B. Great Grey Owl
C. Steller’s Jay
D. Snowy Owl
16.correct: Good job getting this bird fact! The common loon is also on the $1 coin.
16.incorrect: Its actually the Common Loon. The other birds belong to other provinces.

17.question:
Tim Hortons is the largest food chain in Canada. How many locations do they have in the country?
A. 3,520
B. 2,913
C. 1,428
D. 1,371
17.correct: That's right. The values numbers are for Subway, Starbucks, and McDonalds, respectively.
17.incorrect: Tim Hortons actually has 3,520 locations in Canada! That's right. The other values are for Subway, Starbucks, and McDonalds, respectively.

18.question:
Canada is a Winter Olympics powerhouse! At which games did they have their best ever result in terms of total metals won?
A. 1988 Calgary
B. 2002 Salt Lake City
C. 2010 Vancouver
D. 2018 Pyeongchang
18.correct: You got it! Canada won 29 metals in the 2018 Pyeongchang Winter Olympics.
18.incorrect: Its actually the 2018 Pyeongchang games where Canada won 29 metals.

19.question:
Toronto's own Drake got his start as an actor on Canada's youth soap opera Degrassi, but which in which series did he first appear?
A. The Kids of Degrassi Street
B. Degrassi High
C. Degrassi: The Next Generation
D. Degrassi: Next Class
19.correct: Nice work! He played Jimmy Brooks staring in 2001 on Degrassi: The Next Generation.
19.incorrect: Nope. Drake played Jimmy Brooks staring in 2001 on Degrassi: The Next Generation.

20.question:
Which of these famous comedians is NOT Canadian?
A. Mike Myers
B. Nick Offerman
C. Jim Carrey
D. Seth Rogen
20.incorrect: Its actually Nick Offerman, who is American. Mike, Jim, and Seth are all Canadian!
